That 550 MB .avi was probably Xvid; .avi is a old container with many limitations and overhead, mp4 is modern and specially suited for MPEG4 video and audio as such, Xvid, but it's a lower quality MPEG4 video, H.264 (made best by x264 video codec) is the latest high quality high compression MPEG4. Also .mp4 container can have MPEG4 audio or AAC (aka mp4 audio, m4a) if it's HE the better, and if it's v2 even better, but the bit rate @HE v2 it has to be 128 Kbps at least.

So stop complaining about .avi & Xvid, those are OLD technologies

@xpiras: get a P4, DDR-400 RAM and a video card that can decode H.264 video, many old and used cards can do it, so this new system shold be cheap to upgrade.
